fko.tetris.game

Class TetrisTimer

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • fko.tetris.game.TetrisTimer

  • public class TetrisTimer
extends Observable
    This class implements a timer which can be set for an arbitrary time.
    The timer can be queried for the remaining time.
    The timer allows to be observed so Observer will be called via update() when time runs out.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TetrisTimer()
      Creates a reusable timer with 0ms countdown time.
      TetrisTimer(long t)
      Creates a reusable timer with the specified countdown time.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      long getRemainingTime()
      Returns the remaining time of this timer.
      boolean isRunning()
      Returns if the timer is currently running.
      void reset()
      Reset a stopped timer to its initial remaining time
      void restart()
      Starts the timer with its initial time delay.
      void setTimer(long t)
      Sets the timer to the specified time in ms.
      void start()
      Starts or re-starts a timer with the remaining time.
      void stop()
      Stops a running timer.

      • Methods inherited from class java.util.Observable

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • TetrisTimer

        public TetrisTimer()
        Creates a reusable timer with 0ms countdown time.
        timer.start() to start or resume the timer.
        timer.stop() to stop/pause the timer.
        timer.reset() to reset timer to initial time.
        timer.addObserver() to be notified if timer runs out of time

      • TetrisTimer

        public TetrisTimer(long t)
        Creates a reusable timer with the specified countdown time.
        timer.start() to start or resume the timer.
        timer.stop() to stop/pause the timer.
        timer.reset() to reset timer to initial time.
        timer.addObserver() to be notified if timer runs out of time

    • Method Detail

      • setTimer

        public void setTimer(long t)
        Sets the timer to the specified time in ms.
        Timer must be stopped before this is called otherwise it throws a RuntimeException.
        Parameters:
        t - - time delay for the timer
        Throws:
        RuntimeException - if Timer is running

      • start

        public void start()
        Starts or re-starts a timer with the remaining time. Is ignored if already started

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops a running timer. Can be restarted with the remaining time with start()
        Is ignored of timer is already stopped.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Reset a stopped timer to its initial remaining time
        Throws:
        RuntimeException - if Timer is running

      • restart

        public void restart()
        Starts the timer with its initial time delay.
        Stops the timer if it is currently running.

      • getRemainingTime

        public long getRemainingTime()
        Returns the remaining time of this timer.
        Returns:
        remaining time

      • isRunning

        public boolean isRunning()
        Returns if the timer is currently running.
        Returns:
        true if timer is currently running, false otherwise
